index.name: nodejs
index.subtitle: Node.js
index.about: Node.js is a platform built on Chrome's JavaScript runtime for easily building fast, scalable network applications. Node.js uses an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model that makes it lightweight and efficient, perfect for data-intensive real-time applications that run across distributed devices.
index.description: Watch screencasts over a list with the best free videos about server-side developing with Node.js.

videos.title: Buiding a TCP chat server
videos.description: Learning how to building a TCP chat serve with node.js

videos.title: Understanding Node.js's streams interface
videos.description: That is an advanced concept of streams interface and how to work with it in node.js

videos.title: Understanding Node.js's streams interface
videos.description: That is an advanced concept of streams interface and how to work with it in node.js

videos.title: Closing files and understanding process
videos.description: How to work with process and spawing child process in node.js

videos.title: Files
videos.description: How to work with files in node.js

videos.title: Streams one more time and how to create a http server of static files
videos.description: How to create a http server of static files and one more little about streams in node

videos.title: Timers and blocking envent-loop
videos.description: Learning how to blocking the event loop of node.js and understanding timer functions

videos.title: Buffers, how to handling binary data or octect streams
videos.description: Learning how to work with buffers and handling binary data with node.js

videos.title: Modules and request http serve
videos.description: Learning how to work with modules and building a http server request.

videos.title: Understanding first class object and closures
videos.description: Learning how to work with closures and understanding first-class-object in node.

videos.title: Introduction to event emitter pattern of node.js
videos.description: Learning how to work with events in node. It's a basic introduction to event emitter pattern. It is essencial to work with node. This is the first class of free nodejs's course.

videos.title: Tools, Tips and Tricks - Episode 1
videos.description: Installing and using different versions of Node.js and IO.js in your development environment using NVM.

videos.title: Tools, Tips and Tricks - Episode 2
videos.description: Shutting down an HTTP Server in an orderly way.

videos.title: Tools, Tips and Tricks - Episode 3
videos.description: Nodemon: automatically restart your node process when a file changes.

videos.title: HTTP API Servers - Episode 1
videos.description: Boostrap a Restify Server. Add Routes. Resources. Logging.

videos.title: HTTP API Servers - Episode 2
videos.description: Restify Middleware. Route-specific middleware. Using Joi for validation. Validating middleware.

videos.title: TCP Servers - Episode 1
videos.description: Creating a TCP server; listening for connections; events emitted by connections; reading data; transforming data; using a transform stream to implement a service.

videos.title: TCP Servers - Episode 2
videos.description: TCP service as a stream: Splitting the stream, parsing, encoding, error handling.

videos.title: Asynchronous Programming - Episode 1
videos.description: The callback pattern, Chaining calls, Avoid callback hell, Generalizing error handling.

videos.title: Asynchronous Programming - Episode 2
videos.description: Coordinating Parallel Calls.

videos.title: Asynchronous Programming - Episode 3
videos.description: Parallel Asynchronous Iteration, Parallel Asynchronous Mapping.

videos.title: Asynchronous Programming - Episode 4
videos.description: Serial Asynchronous Iteration, Serial Asynchronous Mapping, Limited Parallel Mapping.

videos.title: Asynchronous Programming - Episode 5
videos.description: async.series: running operations in series and async.waterfall: cascading results of series execution.

videos.title: Asynchronous Programming - Episode 6
videos.description: Using async.parallel; Coordinating results between async.parallel and async.waterfall.

videos.title: Asynchronous Programming - Episode 7
videos.description: Asynchronous Iteration using async; iterating in parallel using async.each; Mapping in parallel using async.map; Iterating in series using async.eachSeries and async.mapSeries; Limiting the maximum amount of parallel requests.

videos.title: Asynchronous Programming - Episode 8
videos.description: Using async.queue for building a local work queue.

videos.title: Compare IO.js vs Node.js
videos.description: This video will show the differences between IO.js and Node.js.

videos.title: The Intranet of Things with Node.js
videos.description: This video will show you about how to use Node.js in Intranet of Things.

videos.title: Node.js Continuous Integration to Delivery
videos.description: This video will teach you about how to setup a continuous integration for Node.js applications.

videos.title: Nodejs in Production
videos.description: This video will teach you some tips and tricks to setup a good production's environment for Node.js applications.

videos.title: Comparing Express, Hapi, Loopback, Sails.js and Meteor
videos.description: This video shows the principles about the most popular web frameworks for Node.js: Express, Hapi, LoopBack, Sails.js and Meteor.

videos.title: Node.js Fundamentals
videos.description: This video will teach you the main concepts and the fundamentals about Node.js.

videos.title: Hapi 8.0
videos.description: Introducing Hapi 8.0 at Oakland 2014.

videos.title: Building Realtime Applications Just Got Easy
videos.description: In this tutorial screencast we’ll look at creating realtime web applications, using RethinkDB, Node.js, Koajs, Socket.IO and AngularJS.

videos.title: Serving Content in Koajs with Jade
videos.description: In this episode we will learn how to serve static and dynamic content in Koajs with a deep dive into Jade’s features and functions.

videos.title: Serving Content in Koajs with Swig
videos.description: In this episode we’ll look at serving content from Koajs with Swig: a fast, extensible and popular templating language available in node.js and in the browser.

videos.title: Serving Content in Koajs with Marko
videos.description: In this episode we’ll look at Marko a relatively new and fast templating engine available in Node.js and in the browser.

videos.title: Ditching Cookies for JSON Web Tokens
videos.description: In this tutorial screencast we’ll look at how to implement JSON Web Tokens (JWT’s) by building a simple single page application that leverages this simple form of Token based authentication.

videos.title: NPM and Node.js packages
videos.description: In this screencast you will learn what are Node.js packages, how to install and use them. You will also create own package and publish it to the npm repository as well as learn how to find quality third party packages and how to use npm tool to manage your dependencies.

videos.title: How to create and use Node.js
videos.description: In this episode you will learn what Node.js modules are, how to load and use them. You will also create your own module and learn different ways of exporting functions and variables.

videos.title: Koajs QuickStart Guide
videos.description: Koajs was built by the developers that created express.js, so they bring a wealth of knowledge and experience to koajs. In this episode I will show you how to install nodejs and create a basic Koajs app as well as create custom middleware.

videos.title: Writing Middleware in Koajs
videos.description: In this episode we’ll learn to write middleware, the foundational building block for Koajs and Expressjs.

videos.title: Creating Models in Koajs
videos.description: In this episode we will learn to create models in koajs, more specifically we’ll create a user model.

videos.title: Understanding JavaScript Generators
videos.description: I will show you how to create and interact with Generators, and your life will be better! (I might be overselling it)

videos.title: Callbacks vs. Generators
videos.description: Callback functions makes simple things complicated. Now there is a new options: Generators which will make your life much easier. Checkout this video that shows you a callback solution that gets converted to generators.

videos.title: 0 to Nodebots in 45 minutes
videos.description: This talk will share some concepts about how create nodebots.

videos.title: Production-ready Node Architecture
videos.description: This is a speaker from Hunter Loftis which introduces a node architecture applications case for production environment.

videos.title: Develop, Deploy, Monitor and Scale REST APIs Built in Node.js
videos.description: This talk is from Shubhra Kar and will share some tips and tools about how built REST APIs with Node.js

videos.title: Protecting against csrf attacks in node
videos.description: Last time we saw the anatomy of a Cross-site Request Forgery attack, or CSRF for short. In this episode we'll see how to protect against this attack vector.

videos.title: Anatomy of a cross-site request forgery attack
videos.description: In today's episode we're going to learn about an attack vector called cross-site request forgery and a means to deal with it.

videos.title: How to structure a Node app
videos.description: This episode presents a solution, proposing an app structure that has successfully taken some apps from inception to production. We don't build a framework, per se; we just show a way of organizing our app so that everything has a place, and we know where to find what we're looking for.

videos.title: NVM: Node Package Manager
videos.description: In this episode, I'm going to show you how I installed Node and a fantastic tool for managing different Node versions. Node is under active development, so new versions come out pretty regularly. With today's episode, you'll be able to experiment with the new ones with ease.

videos.title: Auto-restart your server with this weird trick
videos.description: What if there were a way to have our server automatically pick up our changes without our manual effort? That's just the topic for this week's episode.

videos.title: Authorization with Passport - Part 1
videos.description: Thus far with Passport we've created a sign-up form and submitted it to our server, and we responded appropriately based on whether or not our user sends us a valid email/password combination. And that's a good stepping stone, but it's not quite enough for an effective application. We need to prevent access to entire sections of our application based on whether or not the user is logged in.

videos.title: Authorization with Passport - Part 2
videos.description: In our previous episodes with Passport we've set up a way to verify that a user is who the user claims to be. In this episode we're going to ensure that our users have the permissions they're claiming, and we do that with a package called 'authorized'.

videos.title: Testing in Node.js
videos.description: Mocha is a testing framework that provides us with a way to organize tests and group them together logically. Paired up with the `assert` module that's built right into Node, Mocha quite nearly takes care of all the framework we need to write tests. We won't get into testing our route handlers here, but this episode will give us the core that we need to start testing our domain layer.

videos.title: More advanced Jade
videos.description: We're going to round out or Jade knowledge with a look at its more advanced features. Have a list of things you need to iterate over? We've got you covered. Want to include Markdown in your template? There a filter for that. Do you want a style question to start a Twitter flame war over? It's all included in this very special double-digit episode.

videos.title: 10 Reasons to choose Node.js
videos.description: A quick video which shows 10 good reasons to choose Node.js as your new platform to build web applications

videos.title: Building Distributed Systems with Node.js and ØMQ
videos.description: Jim R. Wilson, author of Node.js the Right Way, explains how to build distributed systems using ØMQ at a Node.js in the Wild meetup.

videos.title: Migrate to Express 4
videos.description: This lesson will explain some of the main breaking changes between Express 3 and Express 4.

videos.title: npm init
videos.description: The command npm init provides an interactive step-by-step interface for creating a package.json

videos.title: CommonJS Basics Introduction
videos.description: CoomonJS modules provide a clean syntax for importing dependencies. This lesson will take a look at the basics of using CommonJS modules.

videos.title: What are CommonJS Modules?
videos.description: CommonJS modules provide a clean way to import dependencies in JavaScript.

videos.title: Introduction to Browserify
videos.description: Browserify is a tool that brings node.js style development to the browser.

videos.title: Node.js + MongoDB
videos.description: A hangouts about using Node.js with MongoDB.

videos.title: Node Streams
videos.description: You've heard a lot about node streams, in this episode you get introduced to streams and see how to code up your own read, write, and transform stream.

videos.title: Building NPM Packages
videos.description: The next step is to create the directory for our project. Also, we’ll need to set things up for browser testing, since our template will only support Node testing by default.

videos.title: Introduction to Node.js
videos.description: What is Node.js and why might you want to use it?

videos.title: Node.js First Steps
videos.description: We'll learn out how to install Node.js, as well as how to maintain different Node versions using NVM. We'll also build a basic HTTP server.

videos.title: Modules
videos.description: Modules are the building blocks of Node.js applications. Find out how to use them and how to create your own.

videos.title: Packages and NPM
videos.description: Packages allow programmers to share their modules with the world. Find out how to use npm to install packages and manage package dependencies.

videos.title: Thinking Asynchronously
videos.description: This talk is about some common patterns and pitfalls for working in an asynchronous environment.

videos.title: Hapi 2.0
videos.description: Eran Hammer will be walking through every feature of the 2.0 release of Node.js framework Hapi.

videos.title: Node.js / io.js Stream Primer
videos.description: Get primed on Node.js / io.js Readable, Writable, and Transform Streams

videos.title: Creating Desktop Apps with Electron
videos.description: Learn how to start creating cross platform desktop applications using Electron framework.
